data.text: We make rules so that society can run smoothly.
In Pakistan, the government makes the rules or laws for the country.
The police force sees to it that the laws are obeyed by the people.
People go to a court for justice.
When someone is charged with any crime, he or she is taken to a court.
A judge or magistrate in the court sees to it that justice is done and the person is punished, if guilty.
The Supreme Court is the highest court in the country.
Sessions courts in districts deal with smaller matters. More important matters are dealt with in the High Court of the province.
A lawyer is a person who has studied and knows the law.
A lawyer who speaks for the accused person is called a defence lawyer.
People who have seen the crime being committed are called witnesses.
In cases, where there is more than one judge, it is called trial by tribunal.
